title: My Greek Family Table: Fresh, Regional Recipes
features: More than 100 Greek recipes, updated for the modern home cook
Greek dishes have influenced other cultures for thousands of years. The dishes and preparation are simple; the taste, divine. In

Maria Benardis describes her summers of cooking at her grandmother’s elbow on the Greek island of Psara, and places an emphasis on eating for health and well-being. The foods of ancient Greece are as relevant―and delicious―as ever, showcased in recipes such as:
Lamb with Avgolemono (egg and lemon sauce)
Lamb with Avgolemono (egg and lemon sauce)
Written with passion and beautifully photographed,
is a personal invitation to experience all the depth and flavor of Greek cooking and the wonderful spirit of
―the offering of food to those we love.
description: grew up in Australia, where she founded Greekalicious, Sydney’s first exclusively Greek cooking school. She has been featured on
nytimes.com, Huffington Post, Good Day New York,
and teaches cooking classes at venues including the Natural Gourmet Institute and Sur La Table. Benardis lives in New York City.
